result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis N. Ovard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on May 7, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Revocaiton Summary

(SF) Cases 15CF357 & 15CF443 called at 2:37 pm
Defendant Travis N. Ovard in court, in custody. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court inquires of ADA Shock if the cases are running consecutive or concurrent.
ADA Shock advises he read it as concurrent.

Court does not know if the Defendant is eligible for sentence adjustment when he is serving a sentence that has been administratively set forth by the Department of Corrections for a violation of Extended Supervision.
ADA Shock believes he is, and he has not applied previously.

Court inquires if the Defendant wants an attorney.
Defendant indicates that he would like to proceed without an attorney.
Court discusses with parties that it doesn't have any information as to what the violation was that he was revoked off of Extended Supervision.

ADA Shock requests case be continued to next week, he will contact the deparment of corrections to get the report on the revocation.

recess: 2:59 pm
NEXT:  Continued Sentence Adjustment Review on 5/7/19  (Defendant to appear by video)
Sentence adjustment review on May 2, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: with Criminal Case Settlement and JI attached

Cases 15CF443 and 15CF357 called together at 9:18am [mo]
Defendant Travis N. Ovard in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF443(Initial Appearance occurs):
The Court verifies date of birth on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

As to Both Cases(Waiver of Prelim, Arraignment, Plea/Sentencing occurs):
Mr.Ovard waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Case 15CF357, Count #1 and Case 15CF443, Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Ovard  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint recommendation of the Parties,  the Court reads in and dismisses: 
--Count #2 of Case 15CF357 &
--Count #2 of Case 15CF443

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Ovard

On Case 15CF357, Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Ovard to 3 years  & 6 months of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years &    0 months. 

On Case 15CF443, Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Ovard to 3 years  & 6 months of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years &    0 months. 

The Sentences of Cases 15CF357 and 15CF443 are to be served concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any sentences currently in being. 
All sentences are to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo  any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent 
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--random drug testing at the discretion of the supervising agent
--On Case 15CF357, Count #1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF443, Count #1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court determines that Mr. Ovard has previously provided a DNA sample; and does not order
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 10:20am
